intro: Eriogonum brevicaule var. promiscuum, commonly known as the sticky leaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its resilience in harsh conditions.
